verses.roman:
śuni śivānandera citte ha-ila saṁśaya
kibā premāveśe kahe, kibā satya haya

synonyms: śuni—hearing; śivānandera—of Śivānanda; citte—in the mind; ha-ila saṁśaya—there was some doubt; kibā—whether; prema-āveśe kahe—was speaking something in ecstatic love; kibā—or; satya haya—it was a fact.
translation: When Śivānanda Sena heard this statement, he was unsure whether Nṛsiṁhānanda Brahmacārī was speaking that way because of ecstatic love or because it was actually a fact.
